info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Camden, Pasquotank, Perquimans, eastern Bertie, southeastern Hertford, Currituck and Chowan Counties through 915 AM EST... At 828 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Scuppernong, or 14 miles south of Hertford, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. Heavy downpours with rainfall amounts between one to two inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Currituck, Elizabeth City, Camden, Hertford, Winfall, Elizabeth City State University, Grandy, Ryland, Weeksville, Colerain, Chapanoke, Cape Colony, Tyner, Snug Harbor, Nixonton, Point Harbor, Shiloh, Belvidere, Rockyhock and Indiantown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
